raw_comment:
I noticed that Legacy students overall are almost two times more likely to get into Elite colleges than average students. I also noticed that the graph dipped around the 85th percentile but after that skyrocketed to being seven times more likely to be accepted. I wonder why the graph dips at around the 85th percentile. I also wonder why the two graphs stay the same until around the 50th percentile when they start to change drastically until the 99th percentile. This relates to me in my community as I am in high school and coming to the age where students have to seriously think about college, and things like this help students understand their acceptance rates to certain colleges. 
“Parents really do have a helping hand”
ace_sentences: I noticed that legacy students are almost two times more likely to be accepted into elite colleges than average students.
I noticed that the graph dipped around the 85th percentile.
After the 85th percentile, the graph skyrocketed.
After the 85th percentile, legacy students were seven times more likely to be accepted.
I wonder why the graph dips around the 85th percentile.
I wonder why the two graphs stay the same until around the 50th percentile.
Around the 50th percentile, the two graphs start to change drastically.
The two graphs change drastically until the 99th percentile.
This relates to me in my community.
I am coming to the age when students have to think seriously about college.
Information like this helps students understand their acceptance rates to certain colleges.
The headline is: Parents really do have a helping hand.
